Package moulton.scalable.popups

Class ConfirmationPopup

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.popups.Popup
moulton.scalable.popups.ConfirmationPopup
public class ConfirmationPopup
extends Popup
This is an example of what can be done with popups. Sometimes the user needs to choose between two options before they proceed to the next action, and this popup fulfills this purpose. Admittedly its design does not allow for much flexibility: the constructor calls an init method that creates the contents of the popup on its base panel.
Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfirmationPopup

      public ConfirmationPopup​(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String okId, java.lang.String cancelId, java.lang.String title, java.awt.Font font, boolean exitButton, boolean option)
      Parameters:
      text - the text that is the notification
      okId - the ID that should be used for the accept button. *This ID should be used to remove the popup from the MenuManager (MenuManager.setPopup(Popup)) as an event in MenuManager.clickableAction(Clickable) for this popup to function properly.*
      cancelId - the ID that should be used for the decline and exit buttons. *This ID should be used to remove the popup from the MenuManager (MenuManager.setPopup(Popup)) as an event in MenuManager.clickableAction(Clickable) for this popup to function properly.*
      title - the title of the popup. Set to null for no title.
      font - the font of the text on the popup.
      exitButton - whether an x button in the top right corner should be included in the popup.
      option - whether the option should be presented as Yes/No or Ok/Cancel.

    • ConfirmationPopup

      public ConfirmationPopup​(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String okId, java.lang.String cancelId, java.lang.String title, java.awt.Font font, java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y, boolean exitButton, boolean option)
      Parameters:
      text - the text that is the notification
      okId - the ID that should be used for the accept button. *This ID should be used to remove the popup from the MenuManager (MenuManager.setPopup(Popup)) as an event in MenuManager.clickableAction(Clickable) for this popup to function properly.*
      cancelId - the ID that should be used for the decline and exit buttons. *This ID should be used to remove the popup from the MenuManager (MenuManager.setPopup(Popup)) as an event in MenuManager.clickableAction(Clickable) for this popup to function properly.*
      title - the title of the popup. Set to null for no title.
      font - the font of the text on the popup.
      x - the x location of the popup
      y - the y location of the popup
      exitButton - whether an x button in the top right corner should be included in the popup.
      option - whether the option should be presented as Yes/No or Ok/Cancel.

  • Method Details

    • findNaturalBreak

      protected int findNaturalBreak​(java.lang.String text, int startIndex, int breakFrom)
      Finds a natural word break in the given string text. The search for the break index starts at the index specified by breakFrom then continues going backwards at most to the startIndex.
      Parameters:
      text - the text that needs to be broken
      startIndex - the earliest index that breaks could appropriately be found at
      breakFrom - the index where the search for breaks should start
      Returns:
      the index found where the text should break. If no break character is located within the proper boundaries, breakFrom is returned.
